noun.description: Recognition and enjoyment of the good qualities of someone or something.
examples: she shows a fine appreciation of obscure thinkers

noun.description: A full understanding of a situation.
examples: the bank's lack of appreciation of their problems
they have an appreciation of the needs of users
the appreciation of the franc against the dollar

origin: Late 15th century: from French appréciation, from late Latin appretiatio(n-), from the verb appretiare set at a price, appraise (see appreciate).
